abstract: The Anglo-Australian mining giant Rio Tinto blamed challenges in the aluminum business and at its coal unit in Mozambique for the write-down, and said its chief executive, Tom Albanese, was stepping down.
snippet: The Anglo-Australian mining giant Rio Tinto blamed challenges in the aluminum business and at its coal unit in Mozambique for the write-down, and said its chief executive, Tom Albanese, was stepping down.

headline.main: Rio Tinto to Book $14 Billion Charge; C.E.O. Steps Down
headline.print_headline: Rio Tinto C.E.O. Resigns After $14 Billion Write-Down on Costly Deals

byline.original: By Julia Werdigier and Neil Gough

abstract: Bank of America posts a 63 percent drop in fourth-quarter profit. | The move by JPMorgan’s board to cut Jamie Dimon’s pay was intended as a message for regulators and investors. | Rio Tinto takes a $14 billion write-down and its chief steps down. | A group weighing a buyout of Dell is said to be approaching a financing goal.
snippet: Bank of America posts a 63 percent drop in fourth-quarter profit. | The move by JPMorgan’s board to cut Jamie Dimon’s pay was intended as a message for regulators and investors. | Rio Tinto takes a $14 billion write-down and its chief steps down. ...
lead_paragraph: Bank of America continues to work through mortgage woes stemming from its acquisition of Countrywide Financial. The bank reported a widely expected 63 percent drop in fourth-quarter profit after settling claims over its mortgage business. The earnings of $732 million amounted to 3 cents a share, narrowly beating estimates of 2 cents a share, based on analysts surveyed by Thomson Reuters. The bank’s quarterly revenue was down about 25 percent, to $18.7 billion. The conference call is scheduled for 8:30 a.m.

headline.main: Mortgage Woes Weigh on Bank of America
